title.narrative: Emergency WASH Assistance to IDPs, Host Communities, and Returnees in Dikwa and Mongonu LGAs in Borno State

description.narrative:
This project focuses on addressing the emergency WASH needs of IDPs, host communities, and returnees in Dkiwa and Monguno LGAs in Borno State. WASH interventions - to be implemented in Dikwa and Monguno LGAs- will contribute to meeting the Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) needs for IDPs and host communities in Borno State. Christian Aid and Norwegian Church Aid -both member of ACT Alliance- will provide integrated emergency WASH services in IDP camps and host communities, located in the two target LGAs approximately 90 km northeast of Maiduguri. Among high priority geographic areas, Dikwa is one of the LGAs experiencing a significant influx of IDPs and where seasonal conditions (rainy season) impact on humanitarian service delivery, as well as access. Over 400 people arrive to this location on a weekly basis and as such, there is continuous movements of populations.
Drainage is an important issue, site congestion, disease outbreaks and WASH issues linked to the shelter congestion or lack of space. Accordingly, the project will target 14500 vulnerable individuals, who will benefit from an integrated WASH package as per the WASH sector standards. The targeted population will benefit from an integrated WASH package as per the WASH sector standards for Nigeria response. CAID is currently implementing 4 WASH interventions including one with NCA in Dikwa and Monguno for 12 months. The project is expected to benefit a total of 20000 individuals consisting of men, women, boys and girls in Dikwa and Monguno LGAs.
The following WASH products/services will be delivered through this project: (1) Construction of 5 new hand pumps (2) rehabilitation of 10 dysfunctional hand pumps(3) construction of 1 solarized boreholes (3)Construction of 40 gender segregated latrines (4) Construction of 30 gender segregated bathing shelter (5)Desludging of 80 latrines (6) Distribution of hygiene kits to 1,000 registered households (Note: replenishment kits will also be distributed to this households over the duration of this project) (7) Establishing and training 6 WASH committees and strengthening of 10 existing WASH committees through refreshment training's (8) conducting of 16 water quality tests for the boreholes drilled and rehabilitated and regular chlorination of solarized boreholes as well as regular monitoring of free residual chlorine (9) Hygiene awareness activities will be conducted for 1000 households in our project areas found in 2 LGAs (10 ) Solid Waste Management service will be provided to 1000 households through distribution of waste collection garbage bins and preparation of waste disposal pits
